revised_title: Thermal Effects of Heating and Cooling Palladium in Hydrogen
tldr: The authors investigate the thermal effects of heating and cooling palladium in hydrogen, observing changes in heating and cooling curves that may indicate an allotropic change in the metal. They also discuss the differences in properties between palladium black and other forms of the metal, suggesting that the rapid occlusion of hydrogen may be due to the presence of amorphous palladium.
